name: Chocolate Chip Cookie Pie
directions: Pre-heat oven to 325
Chop up chocolate bars if using bakers chocolate
In a mixing bowl - Beat together eggs until they are slightly foamy (about 5 minutes)
Add flour, salt, sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla to the eggs and then mix until well combined
Add butter to the mixture and mix together
Stir in the chocolate chips
Spread the batter into a prepared, unbaked pie shell
Bake for 45-60m until golden brown and a toothpick comes out clean
Allow to cool for 15-20m
notes: I like to use a mix of semi sweet and milk chocolate chips for this
I like to mix in some coarse grain salt when I mix in the chocolate as well to enhance the flavor

name: Mint Frosting
directions: Beat the butter until smooth
Beat in sugar and mint extract
Add milk 1 tbl at a time until desired consistency is reached

name: Peanut Butter Frosting
directions: Combine peanut butter and butter and beat
Add sugar slowly. About 1/3 cup at a time
Stir in vanilla and salt
Add milk and beat on low
Beat on medium for around 30s

name: Curry
ingredients: Sambal Omelek (adjust to desired heat levels)
directions: Mix all the dry ingredients: Ginger-Salt.
In a mixing cup or glass, mix all of the wet ingredients: Beef Stock Cube - Brown Sugar.
Cut chicken into cubes, rub with sambal, rub with dry spice mix.
In a gallon sized bag, add the liquid mixture, add the chicken, and then add the butter in small cubes.  Mix around to ensure the chicken is covered.
Let sit in the fridge for anywhere from 1 hr to overnight.
Pour curry into a pan and heat to medium.  Add in 4 bay leaves.
Cook anything else you want to add to it like potatoes or green beans.
After around 40 minutes, mix everything together.
Add spinach or anything else if desired.

name: Corn Flake Potato Casserole
directions: Spread potatoes in a rectangular baking dish
Melt 1/2 cup of the butter then mix with the sour cream, shredded cheese, and cream of potato soup.
Spread the mixture over the potatoes.
Melt 1/4 cup of butter on the stove and then mix in the corn flakes.
Cover the potatoes with the corn flakes
Bake for 1 hour or until tender.
